pullrequest.title: updating to new ros key using PGP block format

content.raw:
Confirmed that [a new key came out on June 7](https://discourse.ros.org/t/new-gpg-keys-deployed-for-packages-ros-org/9454).

After some looking around, it appears that the two formats are equivalent except the text version is more convenient in many cases. I think the binary version was probably used accidentally last time. @{557058:4ded1ddf-947e-4154-bbd1-3dba24f1bdbd} can you confirm? Although the old key is only a minor inconvenience for developers who understand how keys work, it causes our installation tutorials to fail. Also, integrating this PR would avoid the need to keep a file that is out of sync with our code base while we’re testing various branches in preparation for the 1.1 release.
content.html:
Confirmed that a new key came out on June 7.

After some looking around, it appears that the two formats are equivalent except the text version is more convenient in many cases. I think the binary version was probably used accidentally last time. @Carlos Agüero can you confirm? Although the old key is only a minor inconvenience for developers who understand how keys work, it causes our installation tutorials to fail. Also, integrating this PR would avoid the need to keep a file that is out of sync with our code base while we’re testing various branches in preparation for the 1.1 release.
